item.description: Base go template functions and func and(arg0 reflect.Value, args ...reflect.Value) reflect.Value Returns the boolean AND of its arguments by returning the first empty argument or the last argument, that is, "and x y" behaves as "if x then y else x". All the arguments are evaluated. call func call(fn reflect.Value, args ...reflect.Value) reflect.Value, error) Returns the result of calling the first argument, which must be a function, with the remaining arguments as parameters.

Data Conversion data func data(data interface{}, context ...interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: DATA, fromData, fromDATA Tries to convert the supplied data string into data structure (Go spec). It will try to convert HCL, YAML and JSON format. If context is omitted, default context is used. hcl func hcl(hcl interface{}, context ...interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: HCL, fromHcl, fromHCL, tfvars, fromTFVars, TFVARS, fromTFVARS Converts the supplied hcl string into data structure (Go spec).

Data Manipulation String func String(value interface{}) String Returns a String class object that allows invoking standard string operations as method. append func append(list interface{}, elements ...interface{}) IGenericList, error Aliases: push Append new items to an existing list, creating a new list. array func array(value interface{}) interface{} Ensures that the supplied argument is an array (if it is already an array/slice, there is no change, if not, the argument is replaced by []interface{} with a single value).

Logging critical func critical(args ...interface{}) string Aliases: criticalf Deprecated: Use error instead. Logs a message using ERROR log level (2). debug func debug(args ...interface{}) string Aliases: debugf Logs a message using DEBUG as log level (5). error func error(args ...interface{}) string Aliases: errorf Logs a message using ERROR as log level (2). fatal func fatal(args ...interface{}) string Aliases: fatalf

Mathematic Bit Operations band func band(arg1 interface{}, arg2 interface{}, args ...interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: bitwiseAND Returns the result of bitwise AND operation (&) between all arguments. bclear func bclear(arg1 interface{}, arg2 interface{}, args ...interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: bitwiseClear Performs a bitwise clear (&^) between all arguments. bor func bor(arg1 interface{}, arg2 interface{}, args ...interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: bitwiseOR Performs a bitwise OR (|) between all arguments.

Mathematic Fundamental add func add(arg1 interface{}, args ...interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: sum Returns the result of the addition of all arguments. cbrt func cbrt(x interface{}) interface{}, error Returns the cube root of x. Special cases are: cbrt(Â±0) = Â±0 cbrt(Â±Inf) = Â±Inf cbrt(NaN) = NaN ceil func ceil(x interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: roundUp, roundup Returns the least integer value greater than or equal to x.

Mathematic Stats avg func avg(arg1 interface{}, args ...interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: average Returns the average value of the specified numbers. max func max(x ...interface{}) interface{} Aliases: maximum, biggest Returns the larger of x or y. Special cases are: max(x, +Inf) = max(+Inf, x) = +Inf max(x, NaN) = max(NaN, x) = NaN max(+0, Â±0) = max(Â±0, +0) = +0 max(-0, -0) = -0 min func min(x .

Mathematic Trigonometry acos func acos(x interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: arcCosine, arcCosinus Returns the arccosine, in radians, of x. Special case is: acos(x) = NaN if x < -1 or x 1 Example: [0m[35m Razor: [0m @ceil(acos(0.5) / 3.1416 * 180) [35m Template: [0m {{ ceil (mul (div (acos 0.5) 3.1416) 180) }} [35m Result: [0m 60 acosh func acosh(x interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: arcHyperbolicCosine, arcHyperbolicCosinus

Mathematic Utilities abs func abs(x interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: absolute Returns the absolute value of x. Special cases are: abs(Â±Inf) = +Inf abs(NaN) = NaN Example: [0m[35m Razor: [0m @abs(0) [35m Template: [0m {{ abs 0 }} [35m Result: [0m 0 [35m Razor: [0m @abs(22) [35m Template: [0m {{ abs 22 }} [35m Result: [0m 22 [35m Razor: [0m @abs(-10) [35m Template: [0m {{ abs -10 }} [35m Result: [0m 10 dec func dec(arg1 interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: decimal

Net httpDoc func httpDoc(url interface{}) interface{}, error Aliases: httpDocument, curl Returns http document returned by supplied URL. httpGet func httpGet(url interface{}) *http.Response, error Returns http get response from supplied URL.

Operating systems functions diff func diff(text1 interface{}, text2 interface{}) interface{} Aliases: difference Returns a colored string that highlight differences between supplied texts. exists func exists(filename interface{}) bool, error Aliases: fileExists, isExist Determines if a file exists or not. glob func glob(args ...interface{}) IGenericList Aliases: expand Returns the expanded list of supplied arguments (expand *[]? on filename). group func group() *user.Group, error Aliases: userGroup

Other utilities center func center(width interface{}, args ...interface{}) string, error Aliases: centered Returns the concatenation of supplied arguments centered within width. color func color(args ...interface{}) string Aliases: colored, enhanced Colors the rendered string. The first arguments are interpretated as color attributes until the first non color attribute. Attributes are case insensitive. Valid attributes are: Reset, Bold, Faint, Italic, Underline, BlinkSlow, BlinkRapid, ReverseVideo, Concealed, CrossedOut Valid color are: Black, Red, Green, Yellow, Blue, Magenta, Cyan, White Color can be prefixed by: Fg: Meaning foreground (Fg is assumed if not specified) FgHi: Meaning high intensity forgeround Bg: Meaning background"

Runtime alias func alias(name string, function string, source interface{}, args ...interface{}) string, error Defines an alias (go template function) using the function (exec, run, include, template). Executed in the context of the caller. aliases func aliases() []string Returns the list of all functions that are simply an alias of another function. allFunctions func allFunctions() []string Returns the list of all available functions.

Sprig Cryptographic & Security adler32sum func adler32sum(input string) string Computes Adler-32 checksum. buildCustomCert func buildCustomCert(base64Cert string, base64PrivateKey string) sprig.certificate, error Allows customizing the certificate. decryptAES func decryptAES(encoded string, key string) string, error Receives a base64 string encoded by the AES-256 CBC algorithm and returns the decoded text. derivePassword func derivePassword(counter uint32, passwordType string, password string, user string, site string) string Derive a specific password based on some shared 'master password' constraints.

Sprig Date ago func ago(date interface{}) string The ago function returns duration from time.Now in seconds resolution. date func date(fmt string, date interface{}) string The date function formats a date [format](https://golang.org/pkg/time/#Time.Format). dateInZone func dateInZone(fmt string, date interface{}, zone string) string Aliases: date_in_zone Same as date, but with a timezone. dateModify func dateModify(fmt string, date time.Time) time.Time The dateModify takes a modification and a date and returns the timestamp.

Sprig Default coalesce func coalesce(args ...interface{}) interface{} Takes a list of values and returns the first non-empty one. compact func compact(arg1 interface{}) []interface{} Removes entries with empty values. default func default(arg1 interface{}, args ...interface{}) interface{} Set a simple default value. empty func empty(arg1 interface{}) bool Returns true if the given value is considered empty. mustCompact func mustCompact(arg1 interface{}) []interface{}, error Removes entries with empty values.

Sprig Dictionary deepCopy func deepCopy(arg1 interface{}) interface{} Takes a value and makes a deep copy of the value. dictSprig func dictSprig(args ...interface{}) map[string]interface{} Aliases: dict Create a dictionary. getSprig func getSprig(dict map[string]interface{}, key string) interface{} Aliases: get Given a map and a key, get the value from the map. hasKeySprig func hasKeySprig(dict map[string]interface{}, key string) bool Aliases: hasKey Returns 'true' if the given dict contains the given key.

Sprig Encoding b32dec func b32dec(arg1 string) string Decode with Base32. b32enc func b32enc(arg1 string) string Encode with Base32. b64dec func b64dec(arg1 string) string Decode with Base64. b64enc func b64enc(arg1 string) string Encode with Base64.

Sprig File Path base func base(arg1 string) string Returns the last element of a path. clean func clean(arg1 string) string Clean up a path. dir func dir(arg1 string) string Returns the directory, stripping the last part of the path. ext func ext(arg1 string) string Returns the file extension. isAbs func isAbs(arg1 string) bool Check whether a file path is absolute.

Sprig Flow Control fail func fail(arg1 string) string, error Unconditionally returns an empty string and an error with the specified text. This is useful in scenarios where other conditionals have determined that template rendering should fail.
Sprig General hello func hello() string Simple hello by Sprig uuidv4 func uuidv4() string Aliases: uuid, guid, GUID Returns a new UUID of the v4 (randomly generated) type.

Sprig List appendSprig func appendSprig(arg1 interface{}, arg2 interface{}) []interface{} Aliases: append Append a new item to an existing list, creating a new list. concatSprig func concatSprig(args ...interface{}) interface{} Aliases: concat Concatenate arbitrary number of lists into one. first func first(arg1 interface{}) interface{} Get the head item on a list. hasSprig func hasSprig(arg1 interface{}, arg2 interface{}) bool Aliases: has Test to see if a list has a particular element.

Sprig Mathematics add1 func add1(arg1 interface{}) int64 Increments a value by 1 addSprig func addSprig(args ...interface{}) int64 Aliases: add Sum numbers with `add`. Accepts two or more inputs. ceilSprig func ceilSprig(arg1 interface{}) float64 Aliases: ceil Returns the greatest float value greater than or equal to input value. divSprig func divSprig(arg1 interface{}, arg2 interface{}) int64 Aliases: div Performs integer division.
Sprig Network functions getHostByName func getHostByName(name string) string Receives a domain name and returns the ip address.
Sprig OS env func env(arg1 string) string Reads an environment variable. expandenv func expandenv(arg1 string) string Substitute environment variables in a string.

Sprig Reflection deepEqual func deepEqual(arg1 interface{}, arg2 interface{}) bool returns true if two values are deeply equal. kindIs func kindIs(arg1 string, arg2 interface{}) bool Aliases: kindis Let you verify that a value is a particular kind. kindOf func kindOf(arg1 interface{}) string Aliases: kindof Returns the kind of an object. typeIs func typeIs(arg1 string, arg2 interface{}) bool Aliases: typeis Like `kindIs`, but for types.

Sprig Regex mustRegexFind func mustRegexFind(regex string, str string) string, error Returns the first (left most) match of the regular expression in the input string. mustRegexFindAll func mustRegexFindAll(regex string, str string, n int) []string, error Returns a slice of all matches of the regular expression in the input string. mustRegexMatch func mustRegexMatch(regex string, str string) bool, error Returns true if the input string matches the regular expression.

Sprig String Slice join func join(arg1 string, arg2 interface{}) string Joins a list of strings into a single string, with the given separator. sortAlpha func sortAlpha(arg1 interface{}) []string Sorts a list of strings into alphabetical (lexicographical) order. split func split(arg1 string, arg2 string) map[string]string Splits a string into a `dict`. It is designed to make it easy to use template dot notation for accessing members splitList func splitList(arg1 string, arg2 string) []string Splits a string into a list of strings.

Sprig Strings abbrev func abbrev(width int, str string) string Truncates a string with ellipses (...). abbrevboth func abbrevboth(left int, right int, str string) string Abbreviates both sides with ellipses (...). camelcase func camelcase(str string) string Converts string from snake_case to CamelCase. cat func cat(args ...interface{}) string Concatenates multiple strings together into one, separating them with spaces. containsSprig func containsSprig(substr string, str string) bool Aliases: contains

Sprig Type Conversion atoi func atoi(str string) int Convert a string to an integer. float64 func float64(value interface{}) float64 Convert to a `float64`. int64 func int64(value interface{}) int64 Convert a numeric to an `int64`. intSprig func intSprig(arg1 interface{}) int Aliases: int Convert to an `int` at the system's width. toDecimal func toDecimal(octalString interface{}) int64 Convert a unix octal to a 'int64'.

Sprig URL functions urlJoin func urlJoin(dictionary map[string]interface{}) string Joins map (produced by `urlParse`) to produce URL string. urlParse func urlParse(uri string) map[string]interface{} Parses string for URL and produces dict with URL parts.

Sprig Version comparison semver func semver(version string) *semver.Version, error Parses a string into a Semantic Version. semverCompare func semverCompare(constraints string, version string) bool, error A more robust comparison function is provided as semverCompare. This version supports version ranges.
